subject: Psychology
title: The Triangular Theory of Love
description: One-minute skill: The Triangular Theory of Love.

hook.text: You're passionate but uncommitted. Your friend is committed but passionless. Are you both in love? Differently, yes.

buildup.text: Robert Sternberg proposed that love has three components: intimacy, passion, and commitment.

discovery.text: Different combinations create different kinds of love: romantic, companionate, fatuous, or consummate.

twist.text: Consummate love â€” all three components â€” is the rarest and hardest to maintain. Most relationships have only two.

climax.text: Love isn't one thing. It's a blend of ingredients, and knowing the recipe helps you understand what's missing.

punchline.text: Love is three things. Most people have two at best.

quiz.question: What three components make up Sternberg's triangular theory of love?
